sentences.text:
borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
Binary package hint: xorg
im not sure exactly whats wrong but it seems to be dealing with gnome, unity, and compiz...
where no matter the kind of appearance change i do ether by using the compiz settings manger or the appearance preference.
The borders end up disappearing along with the panels, which also makes it were your limited in what you can do until you log out and then log back in
also i could not report it while the borders and panels are missing for some reason and if i didnt have Avant Window Navigator i would have had to do a hard reboot.
also i did manually install the nvidia driver but i ended up removing it and installing through the Additional Drivers

Re: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed

Re: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
Well, yeah when you switch between different window managers, the new window manager has to recreate all the window decorations.
That's why the borders and buttons disappear.
The panel is part of the window manager too, so when switching WM's that'll disappear too.
So, so far it isn't sounding like an X issue actually.
Maybe it would help if you write down the exact steps you do to reproduce the issue, and indicate expected / actual results.

Re: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
Oh also, if your goal here is just to get your system back into a usable state you may want to make use of askubuntu.com.

Re: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
this is using the 11.04 pre alpha and i wasn't sure what to put down on this through using ubuntu-bug....
and as i stated all i have to do is change setting in compiz or change the themes through the appearance preference....
some times it keeps working for a while but most of the time it just messes up....
all of the other versions of ubuntu doesn't do this which is what tells me it is some sort of bug dealing with 11.04 and how it works with gnome, unity, and compiz

Re: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
i just got finish haveing it happen again and i was able to run compiz --replace and it fixed things the output is

Re: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
while compiz was running in the terminal i changes a appearance item and compiz stopped with a Segmentation fault

Re: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
Okay, well the segfaulting compiz really makes this look a lot like a compiz bug.
I'll pass it over to the compiz team.
They might appreciate it if you could collect a full backtrace, and/or attach your ~/.

Re: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
ok heres the xsession-errors

Re: [Compiz] [Bug 682986] Re: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
On Wed, Dec 1, 2010 at 11:19 AM, zeruke <email address hidden> wrote:

> it seems that its actually the unity plugin for compiz that is causing
> the problems because when the plugin is disabled the borders don't
> disappears...

only thing is that after disableing the unity plugin compiz
> has to restart with compiz --replace so that effects can still be
> used....

also the unity shell of course disappears with the plugin
> disabled
Please post a backtrace with debugging symbols installed if you can get one.

> borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
> https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/682986

> You received this bug notification because you are a member of compiz
> packagers, which is subscribed to compiz in ubuntu.

Re: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
I ended up looking into the log viewer and in the syslog there is a bunch of things like

"Nov 30 22:55:52 zi kernel: [ 2420.965587] compiz[1894]: segfault at 34 ip 00007f1855301cd0 sp 00007fff70c45e18 error 4 in libnux-graphics-0.9.so.0.902.4[7f18552c2000+9d000]
Nov 30 22:56:23 zi kernel: [ 2451.937535] compiz[1906] trap int3 ip:7f515bf1c6d5 sp:7fffa8129c60 error:0"
messages log has a much of those too but also has a few of

Re: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
this morning i decided to reinstall using the latest daily build and now the only time the borders and panel disappear is if i enable or disable something within compiz and the only types of errors of compiz in the log file viewer is things like
"Dec  1 12:43:07 localhost kernel: [  459.653023] compiz[1701]: segfault at 7c ip 0035af8d sp bfd67c80 error 4 in libsigc-2.0.so.0.0.0[359000+5000]"
so by the looks of it its the libsigc thats the problem now

Re: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
there was another problem but instead of libsigc it was libunityshell.so which happened when i was minimizing 10 or so windows

Re: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
Hmm, there are different issues here.
Things like the libsigc or libunityshell crashers are probably distinct.
Can you install apport if not already and activate it (see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Apport).
Now, considering only the disappearance of the decorations, what is the best way of reproducing it on your system, and which change of settings exactly triggers the crash?
For example, i'm running compiz + unity here and changing the theme in System Prefs > Appearance > Theme: ambiance or radiance, doesn't result in a crash.
Nor does ccsm > window decoration > mipmap: on or off.

Re: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
@ DavidBarth
right now its only when enabling things in compiz and its only when enabling things not actually changing settings within the already enabled plugins

Re: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
doesnt seem to happen anymore except if i set up compiz to work on unity-2d which isnt even suppose to work that way right now by what i know

title: borders and panels disappears whenever appearance is changed
